responses:
I'm sorry, I don't seem to understand your question. Choose a topic by entering 'category:CATEGORY_NAME' to find answers to the most frequently asked questions about CS department at Pitt.
	About Pitt CS
	About Virtual Kathy
	Campus Life
	Education
	General Admissions
	Graduate Admissions
	Undergraduate Admissions
	Test Scores
	Research
Choose a question by entering 'number: QUESTION_ID' to find the answer.

If you don't find the answer to your question here, please contact us by sending email to sciadmit@pitt.edu or calling on 412-624-5015. If you would like to add the question and answer into our system, please enter 'add questions'.
Hello!
Good to see you again!
Hi there, how can I help?
Thank you for visiting us. How did i do, please leave a review/rating
We can not thank you enough for the kind words about virtual Kathy. Your review means a lot to us and lets us know we are on the right track!
Thank you for your review. I'm sorry to hear you had such a frustrating experience, but I really appreciate you bringing this issue to our attention. We will strive to do better.
I am 1 years old! I was developed by four undergrad CS students as a CAPSTONE project in spring 2021!
I'm Kathy aka Virtual Kathy the Chatbot for CS department, shoutout to the real Kathy!
I was developed by four undergrad CS students in 2021!

patterns: How can I buy Pitt products?
responses:
You can buy things at the University store on Fifth, it provides textbooks, clothes, and gifts. If you want to learn more about online shopping at the University store on Fifth, check the link below:
http://www.pittuniversitystore.com/home

The CS department is open:
Monday: 9AM to 5PM
Tuesday: 9AM to 5PM
Wednesday: 9AM to 5PM
Thursday: 9AM to 5PM
Friday: 9AM to 5PM
Saturday: Closed
Sunday: Closed

patterns: could i get info on research
responses:
To look for research opportunities and field of researches, check the link below:
https://www.cs.pitt.edu/research

patterns: any events in the near future
responses: Click the link https://calendar.pitt.edu/department/department_of_computer_science to find out more about our events or contact a faculty
Here is a list of latest news, click https://www.cs.pitt.edu/news to find out more!

To learn more about our undergraduate program, please check this link:
https://www.cs.pitt.edu/current-students

patterns: how many credits do i need
how many more credits do i need to graduate
responses:
Check these links to see graduation requirements:
BS in Computer Science: https://www.cs.pitt.edu/current-students/bs-computer-science/degree-requirements 
Minor in Computer Science: https://www.cs.pitt.edu/current-students/computer-science-minor 
BS in Computational Biology: https://www.cs.pitt.edu/current-students/bs-computational-biology/degree-requirements 
BS+MS in Computer Science: https://www.cs.pitt.edu/current-students/bsms-computer-science 
MS in Computer Science: https://www.cs.pitt.edu/current-students/ms-computer-science/degree-requirements 
PhD in Computer Science: https://www.cs.pitt.edu/current-students/phd-computer-science/degree-requirements

patterns: tell me something about the CS department
I am new to the CS department
responses: I am glad you are interested in the CS department! Here is a web page about us: https://www.cs.pitt.edu. You can also check out this web page to know more about Pitt CS department history: https://www.cs.pitt.edu/about/history
In the CS department, there are multiple student clubs. Here is the list of students clubs we have: https://www.cs.pitt.edu/community/student-clubs

If you are interested in a minor in CS, please read the requirement in this link: https://www.cs.pitt.edu/current-students/computer-science-minor If you have any further questions, feel free to contact a advising staff.
For undergraduate advising, please check: https://www.cs.pitt.edu/current-students/advising-information/undergraduate-advising. Also feel free to contact a staff member to learn more

To apply for our CS degree, check the following information:
For Undergraduate applicants: https://www.cs.pitt.edu/future-students/undergraduate 
For graduate applicants: https://www.cs.pitt.edu/future-students/graduate 
You can also learn more from one of our staff member for more information.

patterns: Where to submit panther card photo
Where to upload panther card photo
responses: Your photo can be uploaded via https://apps.fis.pitt.edu/pcidphotos/.

patterns: Can someone else pick up my ID for me?
Can others pick up my ID for me?
responses: No. Only YOU can pick up your Panther Card.

patterns: Can you provide me with details of cs courses at Pitt?
I want to know more about cs courses at pitt
responses: Which course do you want to know? Please enter the course number in which you are interested in the format of 'CS 401' or 'cs 449'.

patterns: I want to know more about professors at CS department
responses: Please enter the name of faculty who you want to know. Please enter the full name in the format of 'full name:XXX XXX'.

patterns: I want to know the course schedule of this semester
responses: Which course do you want to know? Please enter the course number in the format of : 'schedule:CS 401' or 'schedule:cs 449'.
Please enter your questions in the format of: 'question:(your questions)'.
Thank you for your question! If you also want to add the answer to this question, please enter your answer in the format of: 'answer:(your answer to the question)'.
Thank you very much for your question and answer!
